newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices gain as credit controls lifted.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices gain as credit controls lifted.

text.p: Indian sugar prices, like many other commodities on Tuesday, rose after the central bank lifted credit controls on some commodities, dealers said.
"Increased consumer buying also sent up prices while supplies remained low," one dealer said.

In the ready delivery sugar S-30 rose by 12/20 rupees to 1,305/1,325 rupees while M-30 gained by five rupees to 1,315/1,355 rupees. Sugar mill delivery moved up to 1,230/1,245 rupees from 1,220/1,230 rupees.
Millers said there was increased buying by neighbouring states which in turn restricted market arrivals in Bombay.
